HEAD keeps giving me a SIGSEGV per my message a week or so ago.  So, 
I did some research into the Server vs. Client VM per the 
suggestion.  Turns out 1.5 will automatically use the server VM if 
the machine has more than 2 GB of RAM or 2 CPU's.  

Anyway, I tried launching HEAD with the '-client' option to force 
the client VM, but the heritrix_out.log file kep saying I was using 
the server VM.  However, a kill -3 command to the java process shows 
the client VM in the log file.  So, after looking in the start 
script, I see that you're just running a -version.  This will ALWAYS 
show the server VM on a machine with the above configs. Maybe run 
the -version command along with JAVA_OPTS?

Also, FYI, the new 64-bit JVM for AMD64 will not run in client 
mode.  I was hoping to use the new VM on my hardware to give 
heritrix a bit more RAM in the heap, but heritrix doesn't seem to 
play well with the server JVM.  I've tried this with the x86 JVM and 
the 64-bit JVM with variuos heap sizes..

Thanks,
Greg
